poem:
The Necessary Arrival  

New feet on ancient soil,  
the quiet breath of growth—  
they bring forth the future,  
an unseen tide weaving,  
gentle hands and hope.  
Among static branches,  
the sap of life uncoils,  
whispering renewal,  
distant faces bloom,  
a garden reborn—  
thank goodness, surely,  
for the gift of their coming.
